data.name: web_search
data.description: Search the web for up-to-date information, news, and facts.

query.description: Search query string describing what to look up.

recency_days.description: How many days back to prioritize in the search (1 = last 24h, 7 = last week, etc.).

max_results.description: Maximum number of search results to return.

data.name: file_search
data.description: Search indexed documents or vector stores for semantically relevant passages.

query.description: Natural language query to match against stored documents.

top_k.description: Number of relevant chunks to return.

data.name: retrieval
data.description: High-level retrieval helper that combines file and vector store search.

query.description: Natural language query to retrieve information for.

data.name: image_generation
data.description: Generate images from a natural language prompt using the Images API.

prompt.description: Text prompt describing the desired image.

data.name: image_edit
data.description: Edit existing images or create variations using the Images API.

instruction.description: Plain-language description of how to edit or vary the given image.

mask_hint.description: Optional description of the mask region to modify.

data.name: code_interpreter
data.description: Use a sandboxed Python environment for computation, data analysis, and plotting.

task.description: Natural language description of the computation or analysis to perform.

data.name: shell
data.description: Execute carefully constrained shell commands on a controlled environment.

data.name: local_shell
data.description: Execute shell commands on a local development environment with stricter constraints.

data.name: computer_use
data.description: Plan and coordinate multi-step interactions with a graphical environment (computer use).

objective.description: High-level description of the goal to achieve via computer actions.

data.name: apply_patch
data.description: Apply a textual patch or diff to an existing file or buffer.

path.description: Path or identifier of the file to patch.

patch.description: Unified diff style patch to apply.

data.name: mcp_connector
data.description: Discovery and high-level invocation of MCP (Model Context Protocol) connectors.

connector_id.description: Identifier of the MCP connector to use.

operation.description: Operation or method name to invoke on the connector.

data.name: additional_tool
data.description: Placeholder for any additional relay-specific tool.

name.description: Logical name of the additional tool.

payload.description: Arbitrary JSON payload to drive the tool.
